intro: Erigeron trilobus, commonly known as the three-lobed fleabane, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves with three distinct lobes, and it produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many flowering plants with composite flower heads. Erigeron trilobus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
